item.title: half-life 2/ep 1 skins and models
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Unless the jerks put all the materials/models/etc. folders in a folder called something like “Weapon Replacement”

I hate those goddamn pretentious jerks! Pick a standard and stick to it, ffs!

Read full topic

item.title: half-life 2/ep 1 skins and models
item.dc:creator: snakedoctor
item.description:
i did that…

for the .45, the gravity gun, mp7:

i put all the V models, W models, anything with .xbox .dx80/90 .mdl .phy extension i put in steam>steamapps>half-life2 episode one>hl>models>weapons

the .vmt and .vtf for the pistol in …episode one>hl2>materials>weapons>beretta_92fs

all the .vmt and .vtf for the m4…
episode one>hl2>materials>weapons>v-w_M4A1

there’s a phys,vmt file, assuming its for the gravity gun, with the directory
episode one>hl2>materials>weapons

i have all the .vmt and .vtf for the physgun under
…hl2>materials>sprites

i have combine soldier VMT and VTFs under
hl2>materials>models>combine_soldier

Read full topic

item.title: half-life 2/ep 1 skins and models
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
You just extract the folders to the correct directory.

Unless the jerks put all the materials/models/etc. folders in a folder called something like “Weapon Replacement”, in which case you just extract it to your desktop and then cut and paste the materials/models/etc. in the game directory.

Read full topic
